result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian T. Bush was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian T. Bush is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian T. Bush was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.             ** Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not possess any firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1023 - Atty Edwards disputes items noted in ST's response to motion - requests DE be released on bond pending review of case by Court of Appeals. Discussion held. For reasons set forth on the record, the Court denies DE's motion for release/bond pending review of case by Court of Appeals.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1055 - Sentence recommendations. Defendant is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 18 months of Extended Supervision. 212 days credit. DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. Court costs ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given. DE taken into custody in court. Certified minutes given to deputy.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  132 - Clerk has spoken with P&P re: PSI. Writer has officially been assigned - no further delays in sentencing are anticipated. ST requests new date for SEH - Granted. Atty Edwards moves to modify bond to signature or low cash. Discussion held. Court will modify bond to $1000 cash - all non-monetary conditions remain as originally set. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Per supervisor at P&P, PSI was not assigned to a writer based on original order. Fax and original sent to P&P by court on 5/12 was never received. Clerk has made a photo copy of the Court's order listing originally faxed date and original sentencing date to P&P - confirmed rec'd by Supervisor Jon Schubert - and copy placed in the mail. Attys notified. Hearing to remain on calendar, per request of Atty Edwards, for a motion to modify bond.
At the request of Atty Edwards, SEH rescheduled to allow for receipt and review of PSI to 7/18 @ 1:30pm. Attys confirm by email. (ps 6/24/16)

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  827 - Matter has resolved. DE enters plea of contest as to Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed outright. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.
for Return of Exhibits
Exhibits D3 through D6 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 4/8/16. vm

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in custody with Atty Hilary Edwards.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 200 - Witnesses sequestered. Testimony commences. Witnesses sworn and testified: KPD/TLPD Officer Jacob Bauer, KPD Officer Matthew Curi. Exhibits 1-9 marked; exhibits 3, 4, 5, 6 offered and rec'd by the court. Testimony concluded. Atty Edwards requests this motion be briefed - denied. Closing arguments heard. Court finds the stop and searches by the KPD officers in question were lawful - Motion to Suppress is denied.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
